verbs.description: berattle (third-person singular simple present berattles, present participle berattling, simple past and past participle berattled)

examples: These are now the fashion, and so berattle the common stages (so they call them) that many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills and dare scarce come thither.

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To cry down; abuse; run down.
